isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Diagnostic Tests - Relative Compression Test

svcproc.title: Relative Compression Test
svcproc.para: The relative compression test measures engine speed of each power cylinder at peak compression without fueling. This allows the technician to determine if a power cylinder is operating correctly by comparing the speed of each cylinder.
This test is used in conjunction with the Injector Disable Test to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing this test.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Relative Compression Test from the drop down menu.

svcproc.para: Follow the messages at the bottom of the Relative Compression Diagnostics window.

step1.para: Crank engine for 15 seconds or until another message instructs to stop cranking.
